## Saving .mol files of chemicals

This vignette briefly explains how to visualize and save .mol files as returned by `chemspiderapi::get_recordId_mol()`. 

### Downloading the .mol file of caffeine


```{r,eval=FALSE}
library(keyring)

apikey <- keyring::key_get(service = "ChemSpider API key", username = Sys.getenv("USERNAME"))

caffein_mol <- chemspiderapi::get_recordId_mol(recordId = 2424, apikey = apikey)
```

### Saving the .mol image

```{r,eval=FALSE}
writeLines(caffein_mol, con = file("caffein.mol"))
```
